Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a heart-shaped nozzle, decorated on the discus with Leda and the Swan; Leda holds her chiton in her left hand. The shoulder is decorated with raised points near the handle and the nozzle. At the rear is an Egyptian ring handle. Within the raised base is an impressed palm-branch on a base-line. Covered with an orange slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2028)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (trustees)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
